Northern Trail Outfitters (NTO) wants the ability to share documents related to an opportunity, such as contracts and proposals, with the field sales team. NTO currently has a private sharing model.
How should the documents be shared efficiently and securely?

Cloud Kicks wants to know how many dosed won Opportunities a Campaign has generated over the last 30 days.

Which two steps should the consultant take to meet this requirement using standard functionality? (Choose two.)

choices.C: Ask the admin to enable Customizable Campaign Influence.
choices.B: Define rules for Campaigns to add Opportunities and then lock after 30 days.
choices.A: Add child Campaigns of the primary Campaign source automatically.
choices.D: Add criteria to the auto-association settings and limit it to the past 30 days.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
same as the other times this question has been asked

C & D
No, you cannot directly add child campaigns to the "Primary Campaign Source" field on an opportunity automatically in Salesforce; however, you can achieve a similar result by using the "Campaign Influence" feature to associate multiple campaigns with an opportunity, including child campaigns, through automated rules based on specific criteria.

questions.question_text:
Sales management at Cloud Kicks wants to track the following information:

• Open opportunities in the current Quarter by sales rep
• Accounts that are current customers
• Open cases in the last quarter for open opportunities

What should a consultant recommend to meet these requirements?

discussion.content:
B
Joined Reports: Salesforce's joined report functionality allows you to combine data from different related objects, enabling the analysis of complex relationships between records. 
How to set up the report:
Primary Object:
Select "Opportunity" as the primary object to view open opportunities in the current quarter.
Fields to Include:
Opportunity Fields: Sales Rep, Close Date (filter for current quarter), Stage (filter for open stages).
Account Fields: Account Name (to identify current customers based on opportunity data)
Case Fields: Case Number, Created Date (filter for last quarter), related Opportunity ID (to link open cases to open opportunities)

choices.D: Create a summary report with cross filters.

choices.B: Access to a territory model is controlled through profiles or permission sets.
choices.D: Territories can inherit assignment rules from other territories higher in the model.
choices.C: Territory user assignments are migrated to the new model.
choices.A: Only one territory model can be active at any given time.

discussion.content:
A & B
In Salesforce, access to a territory model is primarily controlled through profiles as they define the basic object-level permissions for users, including whether they can access territory data, but you can further refine access using permission sets to grant additional specific permissions within a territory if needed; essentially, the profile sets the foundation for territory access, while permission sets can add more granular control
